args: When I returned home, I begged the wife for\nforgiveness—but she said that if I was following\nmy heart, I had no reason to apologize.

Our marriage might have been a political one,
but she never resented marrying me. Turns out
she actually fell in love—saw me as a ＂man of
principles＂ for joining the rebellion.
I wasn't half the man she thought I was—but if\nI wasn't the worst man who ever lived before that,\nI knew I would be if I betrayed her expectations.
So I swore from that moment on\nto live my life for the sake of others.
I'm back from my patrol!\nNothing out of order.
In that case, General,\nyou wanna get some lunch?
Quit calling me general already!\nI'm just an ordinary grunt now—and\nI'm afraid I brought my own lunch.
Damn, lunch from your wife again?\nYou could stand to join us once in\na while, you know!
Sorry, gents! I'll tell some new jokes at\nthe next team party to make up for it.
You're telling me! You take your work\nseriously now—even the villagers can't\nseem to stop thanking you!
Now I finally understand how all those\nfolks felt when they stopped fighting\nduring the rebellion.
Living for someone else really IS\nall it takes to be fulfilled.
And I owe Xuan Zang for\nhelping me realize that.

Never mind. Anyway, we've got that joint
exercise coming up in the capital, right?
What kinda souvenir do you think I should
pick up for the family?
A few days later, when I was away at the capital,\nthere was an unexplained explosion at the border\nthat destroyed several nearby villages.
Word reached me while I was in the capital.\nThey said nothing was left of my home,\nand on the list of the dead...
I found a hairpin! And a little toy!\nI was gonna give 'em to...to...
Dammit, I only just learned what matters\nin life! I can't have it taken away now!
Rest easy, sir—your wife and son are\nboth resting comfortably in a shelter.
But...but they were on the list of the dead!
The officials sent to survey the scene must\nhave jumped to conclusions.
Both were on the verge of death and\nheavily burned. Had a passing traveler\nnot seen to their wounds...
Oh, thank goodness they're all right!
Hey, where IS that traveler?\nI need to thank 'em!
The traveler vanished as soon as all\nof the wounded were attended to.

Well, she was wearing glasses, as well
as a hair accessory that made it look like
she had a set of horns. Honestly, she
looked a bit like the Qilin of legend.
HmmMMM. I thought I'd find you here.
Sha Wujing! What are you doing here?!
I have something I wanted to investigate.\nEr, but might we talk privately later?\nWe need to discuss a certain...someone.
I have to see my family first.
Yes, yes, of course. I'll be waiting for you\non the outer edge of the shelter area.
...Well? How are they? All the fingers\nand toes still in the correct places?

They're great, actually—they had
to keep telling ME to calm down.
Anyway, what did you want to
talk to me about?
Master Xuan Zang. As I'm sure\nyou surmised, she came here.

The same question wriggled its way into
my brain, and so I did a little digging.
It turns out that explosion was the result
of a relic in this area.
I imagine she learned what happened\nhere and came to collect the relic.\nAnd while she was in the area...
She saved my family! ...She really is\nan unbelievable woman.
I don't know how I'm ever supposed\nto thank her, but I have to try.
I thought you would say that—and as such,\nI have a proposal for you: What say you to\nfollowing her across the world with me?
Do you know where she is?!
I have an inkling—and I am now ready to\nleave this country and ask her to take me\non as her student.
Collecting relics involves risking one's life.\nWith you at her side, that danger may be\nsignificantly reduced.
I can see why you're into this.\nHow long do you think it'll take?
The number of relics in the world is vast.\nIt could be five years, or ten...\nor perhaps an entire lifetime.
You're concerned for your family, yeees?

I still have my own preparations to make,
so I will leave you for now. If you decide
to come with me, meet me on the hill
in the distance in two weeks' time.
HmmMMM. To no surprise, it seems he's\nnot coming.
Zhu Bajie...\nAre you certain about this?
Sure am. I've officially quit the army,\nand the wife and son have gone off\nto live with her family.
I told her everything: About how she\nsaved my life—and hers—and how this\njourney is a chance to repay that.
Honestly, I still wasn't sure even after\nall that, but the wife told me that I\nshould do it for the family.
She told me to repay Xuan Zang on behalf\nof all of us, and that she'd never forgive\nme if I didn't pay our debt properly.
Hee hee! In that case, no more delays.

But I've got no intention of letting this
take my whole life—we're gettin' it DONE
so I can come back and tell the family
all about it.
...So that's how I came to be here.
But it was far from easy. In fact,\nthere was one time in particular when—
You were the one who asked us to help\nyou decide on souvenirs for when you\nnext return to Taiwu, remember?
Damn, is it that time already? Sorry!
All right, I'm gonna shake a leg.\n...What, you wanted to hear more?
Then let's get lunch some other time.\nIt's gonna be a looong story.
